entries.caption: A box and whisker plot uses the no-mans-land between levels of a categorical explanatory variable.

A cartoon published along with an article in Nature, “Retire statistical significance”, showing this once-respected idea being relegated to the graveyard for outdated and misleading “scientific” concepts such as phlogiston and aether.

A violin plot. The long axis of the violin-like shape is oriented along the response-variable axis (that is, the vertical axis in our standard format). The width of the violin for each possible value of the response variable is proportional to the density of data near that value.

A jitter plot showing gestational period for pregnancies where the mother had five or fewer previous pregnancies. The width=0.2 controls the amount of horizontal jittering. We chose it to make the columns of data clear. Also, there’s no need to jitter in the vertical direction, so we set height=0
